qas.question: Where was Herter's Heine memorial placed in 1899?

answers.text: 164th Street and the Grand Concourse, or Joyce Kilmer Park

qas.question: Where was Herter's Heine memorial moved in 1999?

context: In 1899, the memorial, by the Berlin <a2_0>sculptor<a2_0/> Ernst Gustav Herter (<a1_0>1846<a1_0/>–<a0_0>1917<a0_0/>), finally came to rest, although subject to repeated vandalism, in the Bronx, at <a3_0>164th Street and the Grand Concourse, or Joyce Kilmer Park<a3_0/> near today's Yankee Stadium. (In 1999, it was moved to <a4_0>161st Street and the Concourse<a4_0/>.) In 2007, Christopher Gray of The New York Times described it as "a writhing composition in white Tyrolean marble depicting Lorelei, the mythical German figure, surrounded by mermaids, dolphins and seashells."
